alert.note: Alert for Southern Berkshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Litchfield and southeastern Berkshire Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Norfolk, or near Torrington, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Very heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Torrington, New Hartford, Norfolk, Otis, Sandisfield, Winsted, New Hartford Center, Barkhamsted, Colebrook, South Norfolk, Mooreville, Konkapot, Kelly Corner, Mill Brook, Montville, Beech Rock, East Otis, Cold Spring, South Sandisfield and North Green. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
